title: Props to ghostcrawler!
body:
He's doing what few rioters do, responding to questions honestly and thoughtfully. Hes even responding to all the critical and harsh comments. Thanks dude, I (and probably the rest of the community) appreciate it.

**edit: please take the salt elsewhere. This is a positive thread for the purpose of recognizing something admirable that gc did, so chill pls

Face it you have a hard on for burst / snowball metas, you believe they are fast action and fun. It's sort of what made wow un fun (not directing it was solely you as I'm sure others contributed) . I dislike how much you like the assassin concept and how you don't consider slow paced games rewarding. I'm sure you've directed this season to fit more of your vision, along with other developers help. Just my two cents gc! you do you, but league died for me when you took your concept of bursty/crap mechanics (imo) as fun...

Can I ask a legit question here? Since I have no idea if the OP is refering to some question thing you did, but I'm kinda wondering.

Considering Tristana is very weak right now, and Kayle and Kog'Maw are very reliant on Rageblade to stay relevant, do you have any future ideas to make the micro class of auto attack champions diverse and strong? The meta and game skewed towards CDR and while some need it (Kayle) while the rest don't, these people aren't casting abilities much. Tristana blurs lanes with Jinx, Kayle is basically a weaker version of Azir (Different abilities, similar effects when you really loook at it.) and Kog'Maw as the identity of a machine gun but needs Rageblade. Any ideas on how to make the attacking hypercarries viable?

I will direct you here: http://ask.fm/riotghostcrawler

He regularly answers questions on that page. Unfortunately it doesn't seem like there's a great way to search past answers, but you could submit it there for a better chance at a response.

Not gonna comment on League atm, but Remember that Balance in an MMORPG is not done the same way it is done in a MOBA.

There's a lot more Depth to stuff like WoW's balance. You have a million different factors weighing in on it
Classes, Racial bonuses, Party perks, enchantments, jobs, specializations, mastery trees, pets, auras, Status effects, Weapon stats etc etc

Meanwhile, LoL, while having less technical Depth as a WoW balance system, has its own issues due to inherent differences in the games, the largest being Items

Every character in LoL has access to every single Item (Give or take a few special exceptions). This presents a few problems. In WoW this is easier to balance because Items can be Class Restricted. You probably wouldn't see a Druid attempting to slash Deathwing apart with an Infinity Edge, for example.
In League the only "Class Restricted" Items are {{item:3074}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3085}}

I'm probably just repeating myself over and over at this point, but basically, The two games work completely differently. I have no Idea how this actually relates with most anything here.
